post.body:
Currently most successful people are men. So are the least. The current consensus is that the average intelligence for both sexes is the same, but males are more variable than females.

I call that bull. I think the entire intelligence curve for females is simply shifted to the right of males. In every single hard class at high school and university level, there are far more boys but the handful of girls are always at the top of the class, easily solving problems that stump the hell out of the boys. It's the same at any non-blue-collar workplace, there are more male employees overall but the female minority does a better job, is more productive, and comes up with more ideas. All across the board it's been shown that girls are substantially better learners than boys, and have sharper and more active minds. Girls also have a *significant* advantage in the arts, languages, music, humanities, even just simple functions like memory and emotion. While still having a slight advantage even in "male" subjects like STEM. Pretty much anything involving designing or creating, even simple outside the box thinking, females are naturally going to be way better. Males commit suicide 3.5x more despite supposedly having less depression (I suspect it's actually because depression is biologically hardwired into males so is rarely taken seriously for them, in fact "whining" about it is usually punished).

It's not just stereotypes and observational evidence though. Brain scans back this up too. Female brains are typically a bit smaller, but so was Einstein's. Female brains have denser neurons that more than make up for it, and their hippocampus and cortices are all larger and wired much more efficiently than in males, which correlates to higher cognitive ability. Not only that, but it's been shown that males pretty much exclusively use the left side of their brain (logical, stoic, rational, logical, and blunt) while females are capable of using both sides. This is why men are usually so uncreative, unemotional (except for anger), unartistic, unsympathetic, and lack even the most basic intuition and feeling. Pretty much the only thing males excel at in the mental realm is spatial awareness. And even then, only in the real physical world; females are still usually superior at crafting, designing, and drawing shapes and 3d perspectives. This also makes biological sense. Think back to ancient times, when male was the more "disposable" sex that was constantly sent into risky and brutal situations, fighting, mating, and laboring, while the females engaged more in homemaking, childrearing, and organizing society. You don't need much of a brain to do the former, and with so many resources devoted to it, males lose a lot of other capabilities. Men are pretty much smarter as children than they are as adults! Why do you think Homer Simpson is so familiar? This explains some other things too, like why men die younger and feel pain worse despite having to endure more painful situations.

So why are some men still more successful and have higher IQs? My theory is societal expectations. From the moment they enter school, boys MUST succeed, do what they're told, and do it *extremely* well or there will be consequences. Girls are usually given a lot more slack. Boys are expected to have careers and become independent, whereas girls are allowed to leech off of them their whole lives, and allowed to run to someone else crying for help with every tiny thing that doesn't go their way. So what happens is that only the ambitious girls end up cultivating their skills. And when they do, the results are amazing. But obviously the people who actually *want* to pursue things instead of being lazy are the minority of the population. If you pick out 10 geniuses, chances are 9 of them will be boys but the one girl will be smarter than half of them combined. She will usually be multi-talented, easy to work with, have a lot of ideas, well-rounded and brilliant. Top IQs reflect this, in which they are almost all males but the #1 spot goes to a female. If most females would put down the makeup and snapchat and become interested in something actually productive like the males are made to do, I think their intelligence would improve quite drastically. But we instead encourage that hyper "girly" behavior which doesn't accomplish anything except make it even harder for the sexes to understand each other than it already would be. Boys are far too neglected and girls are way too coddled. It doesn't make any sense to have lower expectations for the ones with higher potential. I think there needs to be a serious shift in raising girls to become productive persons rather than docile crybabies. They'd be happier and have more fun that way too.

"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. parent.body:
Instructions for establishing our petty kingdoms on earth:

>Ps 2:7 I will declare the decree: the Lord hath said unto me, Thou art my Son; this day have I begotten thee. *Ask of me, and I shall give thee the heathen for thine inheritance, and the uttermost parts of the earth for thy possession.*

Ask God for your inheritance.

>Rev 5:9 And they sung a new song, saying, Thou art worthy to take the book, and to open the seals thereof: for thou wast slain, and hast redeemed us to God by thy blood out of every kindred, and tongue, and people, and nation; And *hast made us unto our God kings and priests: and we shall reign on the earth.*

Through Christ's power working in us do we establish our inheritance.

>Rev 2:23 And I will kill her children with death; and all the churches shall know that I am he which searcheth the reins and hearts: and I will give unto every one of you according to your works.
But unto you I say, and unto the rest in Thyatira, as many as have not this doctrine, and which have not known the depths of Satan, as they speak; I will put upon you none other burden.
But that which ye have already hold fast till I come.
And he that overcometh, and keepeth my works unto the end, *to him will I give power over the nations:
And he shall rule them with a rod of iron;* as the vessels of a potter shall they be broken to shivers: even as I received of my Father.

We will be given according to our hearts and our works. Hold on to what you already have. Overcome adversity and preserve the works of God. Be stern when necessary and stand up for what is right, even against seemingly insurmountable odds.

Instructions for establishing our petty kingdoms on earth:

Ps 2:7 I will declare the decree: the Lord hath said unto me, Thou art my Son; this day have I begotten thee. Ask of me, and I shall give thee the heathen for thine inheritance, and the uttermost parts of the earth for thy possession.

Ask God for your inheritance.

Rev 5:9 And they sung a new song, saying, Thou art worthy to take the book, and to open the seals thereof: for thou wast slain, and hast redeemed us to God by thy blood out of every kindred, and tongue, and people, and nation; And hast made us unto our God kings and priests: and we shall reign on the earth.

Through Christ's power working in us do we establish our inheritance.

Rev 2:23 And I will kill her children with death; and all the churches shall know that I am he which searcheth the reins and hearts: and I will give unto every one of you according to your works. But unto you I say, and unto the rest in Thyatira, as many as have not this doctrine, and which have not known the depths of Satan, as they speak; I will put upon you none other burden. But that which ye have already hold fast till I come. And he that overcometh, and keepeth my works unto the end, to him will I give power over the nations: And he shall rule them with a rod of iron; as the vessels of a potter shall they be broken to shivers: even as I received of my Father.

We will be given according to our hearts and our works. Hold on to what you already have. Overcome adversity and preserve the works of God. Be stern when necessary and stand up for what is right, even against seemingly insurmountable odds.

>You're confusing this temporary world with eternity. 

What's your point? We are called kings, he is king of kings. We are called royal priests, we are given a kingdom. It doesn't say anything about this world or eternity, so I don't see why you're trying to apply it to only one of the two.

>"King of kings and lord of lords" is also **just** an expression 

I would be careful of being dismissive or reducing the Bible's meanings to only 'just' one favored interpretation. That's the starting point for religious fundamentalism. It says King of Kings, that literally is *not* 'just' saying "He's a really important dude, yo."

It's pretty clear to me, every time we are called royalty it is implying that we have the dominion of rulership. That's what royalty means. Even most princes were given lands to rule over, that was common practice. In Rev 17:14 he's called King of kings, lord of lords, implying that we are kings and lords ourselves.

And this is the only way it makes sense, if we are made in the image of a King, that means we are Kings. There's no grey area IMO...

body:
1. Yeah I do that too. Even talking about it now could be considered combative. It's such a primal instinct that it's difficult to even realize when you're doing it. I think the only solution is to always take a few steps back and try to consider where the other person is coming from rather than rushing to shove ourselves in their face.

2. I'm not aware of any political parties doing good. I don't even think that's *possible*. This world is run by satan and the ones who want to control people (which is what politics is really) will of course always be the ones running politics. There's nothing wrong with criticizing a political movement but you should never align and submit to a particular platform. What we're seeing right now is a faction of the republican party pretty much running the churches (democrats sometimes too but that's nowhere near as common as they openly hate Christians). I've noticed that whenever the conservative belief contradicts Christianity they will nearly always opt for the former, which is a red flag that they may not actually be true believers and merely use "God" as a political tool. This is REALLY bad. "You shall not bear the name of ğ¤‰ğ¤„ğ¤…ğ¤„ your god for falsehood" (Exodus 20:7). (I am not accusing anyone of this, it is merely a suspicion of mine that this is a growing problem). In some ways they have strayed very far from the faith. We were never commanded to support any political party, and in aligning with worldly movements we are effectively making ourselves friends of the world, which makes enmity with God.

3. Mostly because they're taught that they're just always right all their lives and never really stop to think about it or ponder it. Infants in Christ.

4. Even more rampant than divorce is pride. Self-righteous behavior, virtue signaling, bragging about good works, etc. it's all "we're better than you unbelievers" like the freemasons do with their "making good men better" clubs. Definitely not what we're supposed to be doing, and that's all half the churches are nowadays. A close second is wrath and unwillingness to forgive. Well, at least for *certain* things, some of which are completely made up. No one bats an eye at other serious things like lying, gossiping, divorce, pride, hate, revenge, etc. and even encourages them. Unless they're the victims of it, of course, *then* it's a problem.

5. This is true but lately a lot of churches have become almost all about that. A lot of church services now are nothing but "this is the outsiders and we don't do all the stuff they're doing because we're better than them". They do it to elevate themselves, and not for the purpose of warnning people about those who are untrustworthy.

parent.body:
TLDR and my commentary:

1. Being weird online: Yeah I can get behind this. I think a lot of it stems from the fact that people read comments in their heads with added intent that just cannot be gleaned from most text posts. If there is any hint of someone else being irate or snarky in their text we hear that in our heads, whether that was their intent or not. I try not to be so reactionary to text posts, but even I fail most of the time. The solution may be to read a comment a few times and try to have a better understanding, or just to try and hear it in our heads as not being combatitive.

2. Commenting on politics: This is malarkey. Yeah Jesus and Paul didn't speak much about politics because their cause was not political but spiritual. That doesn't mean that we as christians shouldn't speak against a political party that is doing evil and speak up for one that is doing good. I've long held that lack of political involvement has lead us to where we are now in America, in a position where the godless run academia, big tech, the media and the government. Stop backing down from politics, but learn to control being hot-headed about it, which can lead to going off the rails and give christians a bad name.

3. Handling conflict poorly: I would venture to say that many christians have no idea how to handle conflict in a productive manner. We either avoid it altogether or try to run someone over because we can't figure out any other argument except, "The bible is right" and "Jesus is lord". Though these are truthful the unsaved have no concept of why they should ascribe to these same things.

4. Ranking sin selectively: Yes the church needs to get this under control, but the modern church also needs a refresher on what actual sin is, since many have no idea. Divorce is rampant and widely accepted in the Western church while even looking at a woman and thinking she looks nice is considered sin. Likely this will never be adjusted on a wide scale.

5. Judging outsiders: We are not called to judge the unsaved but to wisely cast judgement on those who call themselves part of the body. However this doesn't mean that we cannot make judgements on the behavior of "outsiders" and determine that they are doing good or ill and then make judgements based on that. Do you want to associate with that person? Do you trust that person? You cannot judge the status of their salvation but you most certainly can, and should, judge the content of their character.

Overall an interesting read, but it seems a little whiney to me.

parent.body:
I think that the picture does show the curvature of the Earth, but not necessarily in the way that people think.

Look at this picture:

![](https://i.imgur.com/dDlvhPS.png)

The bottom red line connects the first tower with the horizon. If you look closely you can see that the remaining towers don't follow the line, but rather bulge away from it. That is what you would expect if the surface was curved.

What people seem to be focusing on is the falloff of the towers on the right side of the picture. I suspect that this has more to do with optical distortion than it does with the Earth curving. Over 15 miles, the Earth curves about 10 feet, and the towers shrink away by much, much more than that.

parent.body:
Thanks for your anecdotal evidence. Since apparently we'll be speaking in those terms... I met a very young woman with dreadlocks when I went to night school who seemed to be generally smarter than me (~140 iq) and everyone else in the class and the other classes. She still admitted defeat or underperformed relatively often, depending on the nature of the question/task; she could barely draw a stick figure and she was no match for me when it came to languages, including our native tongue.

Women did perform better than the men overall, although I noticed that they often had less responsibilities and were less likely to slack which are 2 factors that aren't related to intelligence but will still affect your grades. So my anecdotal evidence actually lines up well with the research done on the topic, unlike your weird ass fantasy. I always thought I was a total simp yet my view of women seems downright sexist next to yours...

post.body:
Currently most successful people are men. So are the least. The current consensus is that the average intelligence for both sexes is the same, but males are more variable than females.

I call that bull. I think the entire intelligence curve for females is simply shifted to the right of males. In every single hard class at high school and university level, there are far more boys but the handful of girls are always at the top of the class, easily solving problems that stump the hell out of the boys. It's the same at any non-blue-collar workplace, there are more male employees overall but the female minority does a better job, is more productive, and comes up with more ideas. All across the board it's been shown that girls are substantially better learners than boys, and have sharper and more active minds. Girls also have a *significant* advantage in the arts, languages, music, humanities, even just simple functions like memory and emotion. While still having a slight advantage even in "male" subjects like STEM. Pretty much anything involving designing or creating, even simple outside the box thinking, females are naturally going to be way better. Males commit suicide 3.5x more despite supposedly having less depression (I suspect it's actually because depression is biologically hardwired into males so is rarely taken seriously for them, in fact "whining" about it is usually punished).

It's not just stereotypes and observational evidence though. Brain scans back this up too. Female brains are typically a bit smaller, but so was Einstein's. Female brains have denser neurons that more than make up for it, and their hippocampus and cortices are all larger and wired much more efficiently than in males, which correlates to higher cognitive ability. Not only that, but it's been shown that males pretty much exclusively use the left side of their brain (logical, stoic, rational, logical, and blunt) while females are capable of using both sides. This is why men are usually so uncreative, unemotional (except for anger), unartistic, unsympathetic, and lack even the most basic intuition and feeling. Pretty much the only thing males excel at in the mental realm is spatial awareness. And even then, only in the real physical world; females are still usually superior at crafting, designing, and drawing shapes and 3d perspectives. This also makes biological sense. Think back to ancient times, when male was the more "disposable" sex that was constantly sent into risky and brutal situations, fighting, mating, and laboring, while the females engaged more in homemaking, childrearing, and organizing society. You don't need much of a brain to do the former, and with so many resources devoted to it, males lose a lot of other capabilities. Men are pretty much smarter as children than they are as adults! Why do you think Homer Simpson is so familiar? This explains some other things too, like why men die younger and feel pain worse despite having to endure more painful situations.

So why are some men still more successful and have higher IQs? My theory is societal expectations. From the moment they enter school, boys MUST succeed, do what they're told, and do it *extremely* well or there will be consequences. Girls are usually given a lot more slack. Boys are expected to have careers and become independent, whereas girls are allowed to leech off of them their whole lives, and allowed to run to someone else crying for help with every tiny thing that doesn't go their way. So what happens is that only the ambitious girls end up cultivating their skills. And when they do, the results are amazing. But obviously the people who actually *want* to pursue things instead of being lazy are the minority of the population. If you pick out 10 geniuses, chances are 9 of them will be boys but the one girl will be smarter than half of them combined. She will usually be multi-talented, easy to work with, have a lot of ideas, well-rounded and brilliant. Top IQs reflect this, in which they are almost all males but the #1 spot goes to a female. If most females would put down the makeup and snapchat and become interested in something actually productive like the males are made to do, I think their intelligence would improve quite drastically. But we instead encourage that hyper "girly" behavior which doesn't accomplish anything except make it even harder for the sexes to understand each other than it already would be. Boys are far too neglected and girls are way too coddled. It doesn't make any sense to have lower expectations for the ones with higher potential. I think there needs to be a serious shift in raising girls to become productive persons rather than docile crybabies. They'd be happier and have more fun that way too.

post.body:
Currently most successful people are men. So are the least. The current consensus is that the average intelligence for both sexes is the same, but males are more variable than females.

I call that bull. I think the entire intelligence curve for females is simply shifted to the right of males. In every single hard class at high school and university level, there are far more boys but the handful of girls are always at the top of the class, easily solving problems that stump the hell out of the boys. It's the same at any non-blue-collar workplace, there are more male employees overall but the female minority does a better job, is more productive, and comes up with more ideas. All across the board it's been shown that girls are substantially better learners than boys, and have sharper and more active minds. Girls also have a *significant* advantage in the arts, languages, music, humanities, even just simple functions like memory and emotion. While still having a slight advantage even in "male" subjects like STEM. Pretty much anything involving designing or creating, even simple outside the box thinking, females are naturally going to be way better. Males commit suicide 3.5x more despite supposedly having less depression (I suspect it's actually because depression is biologically hardwired into males so is rarely taken seriously for them, in fact "whining" about it is usually punished).

It's not just stereotypes and observational evidence though. Brain scans back this up too. Female brains are typically a bit smaller, but so was Einstein's. Female brains have denser neurons that more than make up for it, and their hippocampus and cortices are all larger and wired much more efficiently than in males, which correlates to higher cognitive ability. Not only that, but it's been shown that males pretty much exclusively use the left side of their brain (logical, stoic, rational, logical, and blunt) while females are capable of using both sides. This is why men are usually so uncreative, unemotional (except for anger), unartistic, unsympathetic, and lack even the most basic intuition and feeling. Pretty much the only thing males excel at in the mental realm is spatial awareness. And even then, only in the real physical world; females are still usually superior at crafting, designing, and drawing shapes and 3d perspectives. This also makes biological sense. Think back to ancient times, when male was the more "disposable" sex that was constantly sent into risky and brutal situations, fighting, mating, and laboring, while the females engaged more in homemaking, childrearing, and organizing society. You don't need much of a brain to do the former, and with so many resources devoted to it, males lose a lot of other capabilities. Men are pretty much smarter as children than they are as adults! Why do you think Homer Simpson is so familiar? This explains some other things too, like why men die younger and feel pain worse despite having to endure more painful situations.

So why are some men still more successful and have higher IQs? My theory is societal expectations. From the moment they enter school, boys MUST succeed, do what they're told, and do it *extremely* well or there will be consequences. Girls are usually given a lot more slack. Boys are expected to have careers and become independent, whereas girls are allowed to leech off of them their whole lives, and allowed to run to someone else crying for help with every tiny thing that doesn't go their way. So what happens is that only the ambitious girls end up cultivating their skills. And when they do, the results are amazing. But obviously the people who actually *want* to pursue things instead of being lazy are the minority of the population. If you pick out 10 geniuses, chances are 9 of them will be boys but the one girl will be smarter than half of them combined. She will usually be multi-talented, easy to work with, have a lot of ideas, well-rounded and brilliant. Top IQs reflect this, in which they are almost all males but the #1 spot goes to a female. If most females would put down the makeup and snapchat and become interested in something actually productive like the males are made to do, I think their intelligence would improve quite drastically. But we instead encourage that hyper "girly" behavior which doesn't accomplish anything except make it even harder for the sexes to understand each other than it already would be. Boys are far too neglected and girls are way too coddled. It doesn't make any sense to have lower expectations for the ones with higher potential. I think there needs to be a serious shift in raising girls to become productive persons rather than docile crybabies. They'd be happier and have more fun that way too.
